intro: Gonzalagunia sororia, commonly known as the Mexican flame tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces distinctive, woody pods that contain seeds. It thrives in warm, sunny climates and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Gonzalagunia sororia is also known for its ability to adapt to various soil types and its relatively low maintenance requirements.
